title: A Hamptons Property Fight Over a Black Whaler’s Homestead
description: Property tussles in the moneyed enclaves of Long Island are nothing new, but the battle to preserve the homestead of Pyrrhus Concer raises questions of whose history gets to be honored.
dc:creator: Lindsay Gellman
media:credit: Johnny Milano for The New York Times
media:description: Brenda Simmons, left, and Georgette Grier-Key in front of a truck that holds the remains of Pyrrhus Concer’s home in the Hamptons.
